context.p: Use the euca-describe-tags command to list your tags and filter the results different ways.

step.cmd: Enter the following command and parameters:

example.p: The following example describes all the tags belonging to your account.
example.codeblock: euca-describe-tags TAG emi-1A2B3C4D image database_server TAG emi-1A2B3C4D image stack Production TAG i-5F4E3D2A instance database_server TAG i-5F4E3D2A instance stack Production TAG i-12345678 instance webserver TAG i-12345678 instance stack Test
example.p: The following example describes the tags for the resource with ID emi-1A2B3C4D.
example.codeblock: ec2-describe-tags --filter "resource-id=emi-1A2B3C4D" TAG emi-1A2B3C4D image database_server TAG emi-1A2B3C4D image stack Production
example.p: The following example describes the tags for all your instances.
example.codeblock: ec2-describe-tags --filter "resource-type=instance" TAG i-5F4E3D2A instance database_server TAG i-5F4E3D2A instance stack Production TAG i-12345678 instance webserver TAG i-12345678 instance stack Test
example.p: The following example describes the tags for all your instances that have a tag with the key webserver.
The following example describes the tags for all your instances that have a tag with the key stack that has a value of either Test or Production.
example.codeblock: ec2-describe-tags --filter "resource-type=instance" --filter "key=stack" --filter "value=Test" --filter "value=Production" TAG i-5F4E3D2A instance stack Production TAG i-12345678 instance stack Test
